DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Early physical therapy may effective improve range motion neck shoulder head neck cancer survivor undergo chemotherapy radiation therapy . PURPOSE : This phase I trial study well early physical therapy work improve physical functional well-being head neck cancer survivor receive chemoradiotherapy .
DOC.brief_title: Head & Neck Cancer Survivorship : Physical Functional Status
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Describe physical functional well-being head neck cancer ( HNC ) survivor undergo physical therapy adjuvant chemoradiotherapy . - Describe clinical measure range motion cervical spine shoulder HNC survivor undergo physical therapy adjuvant chemoradiotherapy . - Determine feasibility early physical therapy intervention ( prior adjuvant treatment ) target physical need HNC survivor . OUTLINE : Patients undergo physical therapy weekly 10 week begin 1 week prior initiate adjuvant chemoradiotherapy continue 2 week completion adjuvant chemoradiotherapy . Patients undergo range motion assessment complete Cancer Survivorship Survey ( CSS ) baseline week 4 , 8 , 9 , 10 physical therapy .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Head neck cancer survivor Planning receive adjuvant chemoradiotherapy head neck cancer Has yet initiate adjuvant therapy Referred rehabilitation oncology physical therapy program No metastatic disease No CNS cancer PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Speaks English No significant history cardiovascular neurovascular disease involve disability PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : See Disease Characteristics Not currently hospice care
